course.title: Poems and Photographs
course.description: Brings together lyric poetry and photography as art forms that provide respite from plot's pull toward closure. Explores how poems and photographs engage the mind in different rhythms of contemplation by preserving tensions between movement and stillness, fragmentation and wholeness, familiarity and strangeness, presence and absence, life and death. Focuses on genres of self-portrait, still life, landscape, and elegy, suggesting how particular poems and photographs satisfy mind's desire for non-narrative expression and experience.
